steps.instruction: Bring a large pot of salted water to a rolling boil. Add spaghetti and cook until al dente, about 8-10 minutes.
steps.tips: Save 1 cup of pasta water before draining!

steps.instruction: While pasta cooks, heat a large pan over medium heat. Add diced pancetta and cook until golden and crispy.
steps.tips: No oil needed - pancetta has enough fat

steps.instruction: In a bowl, whisk together eggs, Pecorino, Parmesan, and lots of black pepper until smooth and well combined.
steps.tips: Use room temperature eggs for best results

steps.instruction: Drain pasta and immediately add to the pan with pancetta. Remove from heat.
steps.tips: Work quickly while pasta is hot

steps.instruction: Pour egg mixture over pasta and toss vigorously. Add pasta water gradually until creamy and silky.
steps.tips: Keep tossing to prevent scrambling. The residual heat cooks the eggs

steps.instruction: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C). Line baking sheets with parchment paper.
Mix flour, baking soda, and salt in a bowl. Set aside.
Beat softened butter with both sugars until fluffy, about 3 minutes. Add eggs and vanilla, beat well.
steps.tips: Butter should be soft but not melted

steps.instruction: Gradually add flour mixture to butter mixture. Stir in chocolate chips.
Drop rounded tablespoons of dough onto prepared sheets, 2 inches apart. Bake 9-11 minutes until golden.
steps.tips: Don't overbake - they'll firm up as they cool
